subject: Should I ever catch unwanted Exceptions inside my tests?
msgSnippet: What actually is good practice: Keep the test methods clean and let the testXXX method throw the Exception to JUnit and let junit report an error. (unless you
messageBody:
What actually is good practice:


Keep the test methods clean and let the testXXX method throw the
Exception to JUnit and let junit report an error.
(unless you are testing expected Exceptions of course)


Or Catch the Exception inside the test and handle it somehow?

--
Espen Ø. Pedersen
http://www.corena.com
